author: Carl825
title: Their love, care, and dedication shine through
body:
I am writing to express my heartfelt appreciation for the incredible care and support provided by the Fife Palliative Care Team, specifically, the remarkable ladies I have had the privilege of meeting: Alison, Hannah, Anne, Suzanne, Lynne, Jane, and Lisa.  
From the moment I encountered this dedicated team, it was clear that their commitment to their work goes far beyond just a job—it is a genuine calling. The care, compassion, and unwavering dedication they exhibit are truly remarkable. Each member of the team brings a unique blend of expertise, kindness, and empathy, creating an environment of comfort and support for both patients and their families and friends.  
Allow me to share a story that captures the essence of their extraordinary approach. It reminds me of the timeless tale of the three bricklayers who were constructing St. Paul's Cathedral following the devastating fire of London in 1666. In 1671, Christopher Wren, the architect, observed the bricklayers diligently working on a scaffold. He approached the first bricklayer and asked, "What are you doing?" The bricklayer responded, "I'm a bricklayer. I'm working hard, laying bricks to feed my family." The second bricklayer replied, "I'm a builder. I'm building a wall." However, it was the third bricklayer, the most productive and future leader of the group, who responded with enthusiasm, "I'm a cathedral builder. I'm constructing a magnificent cathedral for The Almighty."  
When I think of the Fife Palliative Care Team, this story resonates deeply. They are not merely healthcare professionals fulfilling their duties; they are driven by a higher purpose. Their love, care, and dedication shine through in every interaction, especially in the exceptional support they provide to my dear Mum. I cannot express how grateful I am for their presence in our lives. They have truly gone above and beyond, surpassing any expectations I could have had.  
Alison, Hannah, Suzanne, Lynne, Jane, and Lisa have not only cared for my Mum's physical needs but also provided immense emotional support during this challenging time. Their attentiveness, expertise, and genuine concern have brought immeasurable comfort to me and friends. I am constantly amazed by their ability to create a warm and nurturing environment, making my Mum feel safe and cherished.  
I wanted to take a moment to acknowledge and celebrate the Fife Palliative Care Team for their extraordinary work and the positive impact they have made on countless lives. Their unwavering commitment to their calling is an inspiration to us all. I firmly believe that their dedication and compassionate approach are deserving of the highest recognition.  
Please convey my deepest gratitude and appreciation to Alison, Hannah, Suzanne, Lynne, Jane, Lisa, and the entire Fife Palliative Care Team. Their devotion and exceptional care have touched our hearts and provided solace during a difficult journey. I couldn't have asked for a more remarkable group of individuals to support my Mum during this time.  
Thank you for providing me with the opportunity to share my gratitude. The work of the Fife Palliative Care Team truly deserves to be celebrated and acknowledged.

title: Disappointing and unhelpful service
body: A GP referral for me. The 1st appointment was very disappointing. I was basically taken through a questionnaire I had pre-filled before the appointment and asked the same questions again that were clearly profiling me. The therapist was not listening or interested just rushing through the questionnaire. Despite telling the person I lived alone they still went on to ask questions if I was a threat to children or others in my household. I reminded them I lived alone only to be scolded and told they had to ask all the questions in front of them. Unpleasant experience, was so impersonal and very robotic. In the end I answered the questions with the answers I felt they were looking for, I didn’t see the point being honest as I clearly wasn’t being listened to anyway, it was just box ticking exercise. Once the questions finished I was told my answers would be reviewed by a senior therapist team leader and I would get a phone call back the next day or definitely emailed with feedback if they didn’t have time to call me. Weeks later and I have not heard anything back from them. Not surprised really it was an appalling experience and not one I wish to repeat. I will battle on trying to work out things on my own and whatever little support my GP can offer. Thanks for nothing !!!

author: Jones1953
title: From the highs to the lows
body:
This is a long one...  
I was admitted to A&E having been found in type 2 respiratory failure. I can't remember seeing the paramedics or any staff in A&E as I was so unwell. I was moved up to MHDU, where I spent 4 days and the care I received was absolutely brilliant. I can't fault anything and wish I could remember the staff's names, but unfortunately I've forgotten. I was then transferred to ward 43 where again the care I received was faultless and the staff where always kind and cheerful. I spent over a week there and then I was moved onto my 3rd and final ward on the Monday night. This is when the highs became the lows of my patient journey. After arriving in ward 6, I was placed in a bay with another 2 patients. The nurses station was right outside and the noise during the night from staff talking, laughing etc was unbelievable (but as much as I couldn't sleep, it was nice to hear laughter). I had lost a lot of weight (9lbs) since coming into hospital (20 days) as I was lactose intolerant and I was supposed to be on an energy dense diet, this rarely happened, but was told by the dietitian that I can eat what I want as I knew my own body. In the 5 days I spent in ward 6, I was offered a wash twice and I was weak so I needed assistance which I didn't get most of the time. I also needed help getting to the toilet, which was down the corridor. Many times I pressed my buzzer and after watching staff standing outside the bay on their mobiles they'd eventually come and switch the buzzer off. Sometimes they'd switch it off, leave and not come back. My daughter, who is a nurse, had to toilet me and help me wash and dress and get me out my bed quite a few times while I was in hospital as staff would switch off my buzzer then disappear, this is basic nursing care. As someone with severe copd I was left to lie in bed, even after I asked if I could sit in my chair. One morning a nurse put me on 4 litres of oxygen as she deemed my o2 sats too low, they were 88% which is the normal range for copd.On the Friday after arriving in ward 6, myself and my daughter were told I was getting home that day. The Dr said they'd get physio to cast an eye on me and then I could go home. My daughter left to get things sorted and said she'd come in later on when I was getting discharged. The physio came and saw me and was happy for me to go home so I messaged my daughter to tell her. She tried phoning the ward multiple times, but was hung up on a few times. When she got through to a staff member it was nightshift who told her I wasn't getting home as physio needed to see me, even though that had already taken place. The next day my daughter arrived on the ward and I just cried and begged her to get me out of here because I didn't think I would last much longer. I explained that the housekeeper had taken away my soup, as they said they weren't getting in trouble for me eating leek and potato soup. Instead for lunch I was given 2 bits of dry bread and a banana (not even a knife to cut it). I was 38kg on admission and 33kg on this particular morning. My daughter then spoke to staff and said that I was for discharge the day before and that my medication and letter was sitting on my table. Again they mentioned about the physio and that I wouldn't be seen until the Monday or Tuesday and again my daughter said the physio had seen me the day before. A member of staff then got my notes and read that the Dr, physio and Dietitian were happy for me to go home on the Friday, the staff member then said that they were too busy to discharge me home. My medication etc were on my table and my daughter was coming for me, so everything was in place. Within half an hour I was out the door and within 2 weeks I'm walking longer distances on my own, have put on a stone and my mental health has never been better. I know the NHS is under pressure and they do a fantastic job under pressure, but I felt there was zero communication between staff and no basic nursing care in this ward. I was just left to lie in a bed even though I asked to sit in a chair many times then had the embarrassment of my daughter dressing me and helping me onto a bedpan, it was undignified to say the least. My mood was so low and hope I never have to return.As I said before A&E, MHDU and ward 43 where brilliant. It's a shame that the experience of the last ward is what sticks in my mind most of all.

author: phipper
title: Rude receptionist
body: We found the the receptionist very rude. We asked nicely but felt they did not answer in an appropriate way. We feel it is important to smile, particularly for parents whose child is ill and especially as we were just asking something.

author: Indie64
title: Staff 1st class!
body:
Was referred with a breast lump on a 2 week wait to breast clinic. Received an appointment 4 weeks later, so wait longer than advised but I wasn’t worried unlike my family, and for those who are anxious this could have been an issue. I also had to ring 3 times before I was given an appointment.  
On attending all staff I was seen by, 8 in total, were absolutely brilliant.  
However the only disappointment was that neither myself or the consultant could find the lump, despite myself feeling it nightly for 5 weeks. My only relief was that my GP and my daughter (medically trained) had felt it. And as expected I found it later that night, so it’s not my imagination. I’m going to assume as I’ve had mammogram and scan where it wasn’t seen it can’t be anything too sinister!  
I’m assuming it might just be a lypoma? Guess I’ll just have to monitor it myself.  
I was impressed how clean, tidy and bright the department was. Staff 1st class!

author: d2023
title: Everybody did their very best to put me at ease
body: I had to go in for 2 fillings, and throughout the time I was there everybody did their very best to put me at ease. I had Dr Susanne as my dentist and she was assisted by Elaine. At every stage of the process they explained what was going to happen and they made sure that I was kept comfortable all the way through a long (60 minutes) of dental work. In particular they took great care to ensure that the fillings matched the colour of my teeth.

readBy.name: Perth and Kinross Health & Social Care Partnership

author: aquariusfs46
title: A rude member of admin staff
body:
There is a member of staff on reception in orthopaedic outpatients dept who is in my opinion not professional enough for the job.  
My first encounter with them was in early May. They made me wait while fumbling around trying to separate 2 sheets of paper with patients names on. I had already given my details but they literally stood there fumbling for at least a minute trying to separate 2 sheets of paper! I didn't have the patience to wait and watch this fiasco so I walked off to section A, hand therapy. They shouted after me to ask where I was going!?  
The second encounter was later in May. I asked a question about the DEXA clinic. There was a helpful person working in the office who started to answer my question but the rude person at the front desk said not to talk over them. The helpful staff member appeared extremely upset at being humiliated in front of a patient and immediately got up and left the office  
I asked them later if the person was a volunteer and was told no.

readBy.name: Dorset County Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

author: David23
title: Support at home
body:
Linsay from the Reach team came out as my mum was having mobility difficulties at home.  
She was friendly, knowledgeable, caring and compassionate and arranged several different aids to help make things easier at home.

title: Poor experience
body:
I recently attended a&e personally for first time due to severe pain for a week.
We waited 4.5hr as busy so although frustrating/in pain I accepted this. Nurses kind during this time & did bloods.

Saw a doctor for literally 2min. He didn't ask me or give me the opportunity to tell him my symptoms, did do very basic exam but felt like I was just a nuisance and he was trying to discharge asap.
He said nothings wrong, take some antibiotics in case. When I tried to ask about ongoing pain as the only reason I presented was due to needing strong painkillers daily (which found at home luckily) he said continue. 

I am very disappointed and went home feeling upset, it was complete waste of time, nothing gained. I never attend hospitals/doctors because I am a doctor myself so often self-diagnose & allow things to improve themselves as don't wish to use there time unnecessarily. However, I attended this time as was generally worried about the severity and wondered if i needed further investigations / least rule diagnoses. If a thorough history/exam was conducted and nothing else needed I would have been reassured but the fact they didn't even know /care felt me feeling very worried & disheartening.

To add, my family have attended this a&e in past and had good experiences & been treated well & we always praised the hospi tal including a&e. I think I got very unlucky this day with the specific doctor.

author: Hokutenyu
title: Kindness and patience makes such a difference
body:
I just want to express my appreciation for Trisha at the Aberdeen Royal Infirmary, at a time when I was feeling disgruntled with another private hospital and probably being a pain.  
I know her to be busy but she still found the time, with great kindness and patience, to unruffle my feathers and put my care back on track.  
.

readBy.name: Aberdeen City Health & Social Care Partnership

author: Dougie man
title: Understanding, sympathetic and professional
body: My wife was discharged from hospital. The next day the care coordinator visited less than an hour after my wife returned home, and a care package of carers twice a day, morning and evening was immediately arranged. The first carer arrived that evening. Since then, the support we have had from carers has been excellent - understanding, sympathetic and professional. Now that my wife can manage without carers, we have been able to end the service. We cannot overstate our appreciation of the service we have received, and our warmest thanks go to all involved in setting up this service, and providing it so seamlessly.

title: No help
body: When I need urgent help I need to call them at 8am. I tried to call them many times, but I couldn't speak with anyone. This is not the first time. Last time I called them for 3 days. Nothing. What can I do if I need help? Do I need to go to a private doctor?

title: Awful practice
body: This practice is genuinely one of the worst practices I have ever come across, getting an appointment is borderline impossible as the receptionists never pick up the phone. I’ve been told wrong information from the receptionists on multiple occasions as well as pre booking an appointment for a slight emergency and never getting called. Never mind the attitudes of some of the receptionists  being absolutely awful. I’ve called at 8am on the dot on multiple occasions to get an appointment and never had anyone pick up the phone, it’s is never an easy relaxed experience.

author: angel03
title: quitting smoking
body:
Kathleen’s positive attitude and helpfulness to me finally quitting after 3/4 years of smoking helped me achieve my goal.  
I have felt amazing and still do!

title: Excellent care
body: Three monthly visits for Macular injections so far. Very prompt and caring staff despite it being obvious that they are vastly overstretched.  I wish it was easier to contact the department (ophthalmology) and that communication and information was easier and more consistent.

title: Poor scheduling, poor service, poor all round.
body: Have a Danalogic set of hearing aids from Peterborough's InHealth Audiology dept, had two units develop catastrophic failures in 12 months, trying to get a repair/replacement appointment with them is shocking, they need to understand that without the aid(s) we are essentially deaf and expecting those who have faulty unit(s) to wait 7-8 weeks for an appointment (both times) is utterly unacceptable and shambolic, it isolates us from many day-to-do day activities most can take for granted and they show no sympathy or empathy whatsoever. I'm now stuck, severely deaf on one side for over a month because they cant get me in sooner or even programme a spare for me to collect to use in the meantime, yet when you go for an appointment theres usually a few of them standing around chatting or mooching about.

author: sambaer95
title: The staff do everything they can to support you
body:
When I first arrived here I was really nervous but as soon as I walked through the door I felt welcomed by all the staff. The doctor sat down with me and went through a plan of action for my detox which put me at ease . The food is nice here and it is in a homely place it made me feel more comfortable and I feel I have been able to detox without been pushed.  
We had meditation at 11 am every morning which I really found effective. The staff / nurse/ doctors here do everything they can to support you and make sure you feel like you will succeed and we had group at 3:00pm everyday and did quizzes.  
I feel quite nervous to leave now. I really appreciate everything this detox unit has done for me, they have saved my life and helped me onto the next stage of my life. I'm really grateful.

author: CotfieldF
title: A great experience
body: Our Daughter needed an urgent eye examination under a general anaesthetic due to her ASD yesterday. Communication from the referrers in NHS Borders to the Crichton Unit where she was seen was excellent. She was seen promptly and the nurses and support workers were great in helping my daughter feel at ease. Warmth and understanding at every stage. The wait for our surgery slot was made easier by a well equipped and varied playroom and play coordinator which helped keep our Daughter from becoming too anxious. It was evident that the unit was well led by the kind charge nurse and staff enjoyed their jobs. Freddie the surgeon and his team also examined, explained and approached with such care and friendliness. A great experience which we don’t often face with a child who has invisible and often misunderstood needs.

title: Unable to make followup appt, 30mins hold no…
body: Had a good session with physio.  She said to make followup appointment in 6-8 weeks.  I tried calling Practice Plus Group MSK Buckinghamshire number 0333 999 2586.  Was told I was caller number 9 in queue, waited for 28 minutes to get ring tone, then no-one picked up.  I assume the same was true for other people in the queue.

title: Ridiculous delivery
body: I am still in a call queue.  I’ve been waiting for 80 minutes - yes that’s eighty minutes - to speak to someone about my mother who has dementia

title: New staff
body: This is a Doctors practice not a solicitors office or a brickyard and any new staff should be employed with the required skills. Empathy, sympathy and consideration for it's patients being main priority. After over 50 yrs history with them I've just had a phone battle with an automaton with the telephone skills of the speaking clock... A truly horrendous experience just trying to reorder prescriptions for my elderly, dementia stricken frail old mum whom I do my best to care for. Talked over and treated like a child by a staff member better suited to working in an environment where being abrupt and rude would be deemed an asset... Very disappointed.

title: awful to deal with
body: total waste of time, 3 weeks trying to get an appointment and now ran out of medication and acute drugs included but wont prescribe till I have been seen..........no appointments for a week,  very poor service

author: hydruscz57
title: I really appreciate their care and support
body:
I rang the Immunology department to check if they could help me. I needed a letter to confirm a health issue.I didn’t know if they would be able to help but I know that they will always listen and will help if they possibly can. I think it was a receptionist /office manager called Angela who took my call. She is always very professional and efficient. She took brief details and told me that someone would get back to me. The Immunology department is always extremely busy but I always feel that the staff always make time and I feel supported as I manage my health issues.  
I got a phone call from a clinical fellow called Dr Beverland later that day. He was on my call when he had to leave to attend an emergency. I was very surprised when he took time to ring back. I explained my problem as briefly as possible and told him that there was no need to ring back if the department couldn’t help. I didn’t want to take any more of their valuable time. Dr Beverland had to refer my query to one of the Consultant Immunologists. I am not sure if Dr Devlin , Dr Coulter or some other senior member of staff approved my request. Dr Beverland relayed my query very accurately and I received a letter with exactly the information I required.  
I am very thankful to Angela, Dr Beverland and all the staff in the immunology department who support me as I navigate my health issues. I really appreciate their care and support. They are an excellent team and demonstrate the very best of inter-professional practice.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: Joel5686
title: Pressure ulcer
body: Had infected pressure sore in February, had to have debridement to clear necrotic tissues. I’ve been having district nurses come to my home every three days for the past months to change my dressings. Amal has been wonderful

title: Unable to cancel appoitment
body: Had an appointment sent through several txt reminders rang up numerous of occasions say the appointment is not needed unable to get through. Can not sit on phone all day in a queue surly an email address or being able to reply to txt would save money and free up appointments that are needed

author: hydrakh93
title: Amazing service
body:
I had a DIY accident at home, dislocated my shoulder and fractured it at the tip of the humerus, hit my head and landed on my private area onto the floor joist  
All the staff have been amazing, from Sodexo staff, to nurses and doctors.  
I cant thank you all enough for your caring manner and professional support, everyone I have been in contact with from porters, cleaners, nurses and doctors, I cant fault, their bedside manner has been amazing, while trying to balance a very busy ward.  
I am so grateful for what you all do as a well oiled machine, and how you all logistically work round each other in such a manner its magical. I just want the public to realise how much you all do under so much pressure while keeping such lovely smiles and great humor 😊  
Thank you all so so much and long live the NHS, as what you all do is above and beyond your duty, and I would be willing to pay a monthly tax to the NHS, because in my opinion privatisation will be a shock to those that don't notice what we have as a nation and what amazing service we get within the amounting pressure on the system and currently all for free!  
So grateful and thank you from the bottom of my heart you have all been fabulous, amazing and best of all been able to have a joke and laugh in a typical British manner!  
Regards to all staff and please keep being you,

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

title: NHS Health Check
body:
I received an SMS message from Blackthorn Health Centre to book a health check. The SMS message coincided with NHS ads about health checks for males in Hampshire (cannot believe this is a coincidence!)
When I called to book an appointment, I was told 'management' had decided to stop appointments, so there were none available.
I mentioned that the NHS ads mentioned that heath checks should be offered every 5 years from age 45. I have been with this surgery since 2004 (aged43) and have yet to have a health check - therefore not assesed / checked at 45, 50, 55 or 60.
As well as the lack of appointments, I also dislike the negative and overly long telephone message. The message seems geared to not providing services and is un-friendly in its content and delivery.
A poor customer experience in my opinion. Perhaps 'management' need reminding that the service is funded by clients taxes and is not 'free' and therefore in their gift to provide services as and when they like.
I accept the pressure the NHS is under, however this practise could at least soften its telephone messaging and at least try to give a better impression of providing a community health service.

title: Post Op
body: Had mvd surgery in 2020. All follow up appointments were by telephone (even though this is a physical disability) which were either not on the date it was booked nor at the correct time (the first call the person I spoke to didn't even know when I had had the operation). Nor was it ever with the surgeon who did the operation. The final call lasted less than 5 minutes where I was told there was nothing further that could be done and that I would have to learn to live with it. There appears to be no concern on how this type of news can affect you mentally and certainly shouldn't be delivered via a telephone call.

title: Very efficient
body:
This clinic is great
Finding it is a problem. You need to put the full address in your phone or sat nav otherwise you end up in a private drive with houses. It needs better signage from the road.

author: hydruscz57
title: Emergency care for a painful eye
body:
My husband had a sore eye and the original diagnosis was viral conjunctivitis. After a few days his eye was very painful and there was a yellow discharge. I rang a couple of high street opticians as it was a Saturday. Unfortunately they had no emergency appointments so I decided to try a local optician. I was surprised that they were open. A very helpful receptionist took the details . She explained that she needed to ask a few triage questions. She listened carefully and was reassuring.  
Shortly afterwards an optician called Laura phoned back. She explained that my husband needed urgent attention and said that she would make time to see him. When we arrived the opticians was really busy so my husband and myself appreciated that the optician was going above and beyond to make time to see him.  
Laura examined his eye and explained why he was in so much pain. She put in pain relief drops and prepared his eyes so that they would be ready for examination at Altnagelvin Hospital. He was given a letter to bring to the emergency eye clinic at the hospital. My husband would like to thank the optician for her help. She was very professional. She explained everything clearly and took time to reassure him. The practice was very busy so we both would like to thank the staff at the opticians for the excellent service provided.  
I took my husband to the emergency eye clinic at Altnagelvin Hospital. We had an emergency letter from the opticians. A receptionist took my husband’s details. She confirmed some details and then took us through to a waiting area. Shortly afterwards my husband was seen by a doctor/specialist. My husband can’t remember his name but said that he was excellent. He was helpful and reassuring. He explained that he had an eye ulcer and blepharitis and took time to supply my husband with some emergency drops and a letter for his GP. We would like to thank the receptionist and the doctor for their help.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

title: Unknown
body: I went to the surgery and changed my details. Great. Got on the kilminy site. OK. Logged in. OK. All I need to do is see someone so I can get repeat prescription service back up. Nope. Don't go out and make a service that confuses. I am now under the West Yorkshire AAA screening and right now but all OK I'm under them. But to book a review of prescriptions it's actually a joke. And no I will not wait on a phone for 2 hours and get told there are no more positions left

title: Really poor, no call back
body: Husband had really bad toothache with temperature with earache & headache. Called at 9.30 on Sunday being told call back within 2 hrs, it’s now Tuesday and no one ever called. Had a couple of calls saying his on the list and will be called but never did. Call handler at start was like a robot and quite abrupt. The calls we had to say he was still on a list were hard to understand as didn’t speak very good English.I don’t think I will ever use this service again.

title: More advice please.
body: My doctor was very pleasant and polite. She asked lots of questions and examined my stomach. There was nothing to be done as she expected a viral infection. I would have liked more advice on what to eat/not eat and anything I could do myself to get through the illness. A request of stool sample would have  been helpful as I’m still ill 4 days later and have now had to make another appointment to have a stool sample recommended.

title: When will Southwell cast off the cloak of covid?
body: Unfortunately, the surgery is still requesting masks to be worn.  The pandemic is over according to world health organisation and the national health service (review wouldn't let me use capitals)  and even Newark hospital has stopped wearing masks.  Really is time to move on and get back to some normality!

title: Review
body: I had a text saying a Dr wanted me to have a blood test,so I rang up, got through & made an appointment for the following day, I went to the Grange & have the blood, in & out in 10 mins, all good

author: Boxerdoglover23
title: Feeling no further forward and disheartened.
body:
I had my appointment at the end of May having been referred back in January due to some abscess/welts appearing on my breasts. After my referral I began developing some hard lumps in my breast and ended up getting an urgent referral for Forth Valley Royal.  
Upon my arrival the staff were absolutely lovely and I quickly felt more at ease. I was seen by my consultant who was lovely but they did not have my file in front of them. They started going through the referral and I said that that the information wasn’t mine resulting in me ultimately finding out confidential information about another patient. The consultant did apologise for this.  
My consultant asked some questions and did an examination. They found lumps in my right breast, didn’t believe that it was anything untoward but to make sure I was sent for an ultrasound scan. I got to the ultrasound department, again the staff were lovely and made me feel relaxed. I was told that I had lumps but nothing to worry about and that I had little pockets where my welts were inside the breast. I got sent round to see my consultant again as I had some further questions. I had asked about what I could do in order to get rid of the welts and lump and what causes it. I didn’t get any answers apart from that I had to buy a cotton bra. I felt as though it was very rushed and quite dismissive as if to say; you don’t have cancer, your fine, go. I felt I was no further forward and felt disheartened. I was relieved that it was nothing serious but I also had no answers as to what is actually wrong with me.

readBy.name: Office of Annabelle Ewing, MSP for Cowdenbeath

title: Extremely poor
body: I have been trying to get a appointment for my 10 year old son for well over a month now, it does not matter what time of day you call or even waiting at the surgery to get an appointment you are always told the same thing “ we do not have any appointments available try again next week” we can not self refer to the service we need for him because he has to be seen by a GP first so we are stuck on what to do , my son’s symptoms are getting worse and causing him distress. But this surgery is taking on more patients when they obviously can not handle the amount of patients they already have. Last month my son was having an asthma attack in the doctors waiting room and they refused to see him , thank goodness for the pharmacist next door that came to his rescue, he was later diagnosed with a chest infection! The practice managers need to start managing this practice before a life is lost

author: Simo78
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Chithurst Monastery Trip
body: “The Chithurst day lacked structure and the fitness and mobility levels needed to be ascertained for the walk that was undertaken”

title: Waste time
body: I wait for 8 months for appointment and for 3 time they cancelled and change date,and now I wait another one month......I thing they take money from government (our taxes)for nothing....very poor service

title: Quick response
body: Really delighted to use Klinik - online service to request a doctor call back. Submitted at 12.30 - call back same afternoon! Really great service - saves trying to get an appointment and wasting surgery time too!

title: Switchboard
body: I waited over 7 minutes for a reply from the switchboard then gave up. Are there too few operators? Much too slow and makes it an expensive call to get nowhere

author: Simo78
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Good day out
body: Everyone really loved the day out to Chithurst monastery with the Fareham and Gosport Service User Forums. Off the back of the trip a group of Alcoholics Anonymous members are going to arrange a trip to the Chithurst monastery this summer

title: Appointments made without reading the facts.
body: Had 2 appointments with Rheumatology, one by phone then decision made to see me a couple of weeks later. Saw a nurse who arranged an x Ray on my swollen finger with a view to having a steroid injection. Told her that I was on holiday from 6th June and not to arrange anything then. Guess what got an appointment for 6th June !! Phoned to change the appointment and given today 30th May. Arrived on time, taken in to see a registrar who told me he was not trained to inject fingers and no one on site to do it. Came away without an injection and as I am on holiday for 6 weeks have to suffer pain in a very sore joint. When are people who arrange appointments going to take note of holiday dates and check if the Doctor is in fact trained to carry out the procedure you are booked in for.

author: Simo78
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Helpful Trip
body: During the recent trip to the Chithurst monastery, I stayed in the great hall to begin with. There was a fantastic introduction from the lead monk, followed by some chanting from all the monks. It was quite emotion provoking during the chanting. I then had an opportunity to listen to someone in the main house and felt that this made a real difference to this person, but also helped me.

title: Poor Telephone Services
body: On the 30th May 2023 I phoned the practice around 3pm and for an hour I had been put in a queue which I was at first 4th in the line which was repeatedly saying that I was 4th in the line 25 times. Then when I was second in the line it kept saying that 20 times. You really need to fix up your phone services otherwise no one will ever be able to attentively communicate with you about their medical issues.

title: X-Ray Dept
body: Turned up for an x-ray, no appt just walk in. Gave my details, sat down, given a gown,called in for x-ray took all in all 13 mins. Blooming brilliant service.A*

title: Caring service
body: Had a blood test, Doctor rang with results,  discussed any issues , requested an xray and was given hosp xray day after. Excellent service once again from this doctors that gets bad press .

title: receptionist is not helpful
body: Helped my father to book appointment, and requested the GP to contact my father's number. GP called the wrong number, I tried to contact the receptionist, staff will ask the GP to contact my father in the afternoon. My father has not received any calls, I tried to contact the surgery again. I was told the GP will not contact the patient more than twice and I need to call them for the appointment next day. 1. Why they do not tell me on last phone conversation. Receptionist is unprofessional and not helpful. 2. It is not our fault of not answering the calls. The GP made mistake, why they cannot have special appointment to allow us to see the GP. Service from the surgery become worse and worse. 3. Even I contacted the GP at 8 o'clock, I will be late for my work. so hard to book an appointment. Not friendly for older patient, hard to book appointment for them, not accommend.

title: Excellent practice
body: Best surgery , staff are very helpful and courteous. Extremely helpful and caring doctors and practice nurse

author: Simo78
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: I have learnt a lot
body: I’ve had such a good time since I’ve been with you guys at the Chooseday Voice forum. I’ve spent time with all sorts of different people and I’ve learnt a lot.

title: Needs improvement
body: Admin and getting hold of anyone via phone or email is near impossible. The only way to sort things out is face to face at the surgery. Econsult needs an overhaul - women’s health isn’t even an option you’re able to select, let alone anything that comes under that umbrella. Drs very strapped for time as usual. I have found if I do my own research and go to my Dr with specific requests then I am listened to, otherwise my long term womens health issue is usually dismissed.

title: Excellent medically, poor admin.
body:
Contacted by text message.Had two appointments the latter being 17/5/23 at Bromsgrove.Excellent service from technician and specialist.
Today 30/5/23 received Two letters telling me that I have an appointment on 17/5/23. Yes the appointment I attended.
The admin.clearly needs sorting out, but I say again the medical side was first rate
R Hancox
I

title: Excellent
body:
I attended the Endoscopy unit last Saturday which was something I wasn’t looking forward to😬 however my experience was superb (I still wouldn’t volunteer for another visit) but a not so nice procedure was made so much better by a great team of people 😊

From walking through the door I was put at ease, informed of what to expect, updated on my procedure as it was being performed and given an evaluation once it was complete. 

Superb department 

Superb staff 

10/10 

Thank you so much for your care and attention 😀😀

readBy.name: Doncaster and Bassetlaw Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Very poor
body: although the doctors provide a good service, getting the appointment is extremely difficult. The system used to book an appointment is difficult to use. The surgery never answers the phone no matter what time you call. Doctors often do not call within the 48 hours timeframe they give, which means to you have to physically go into the surgery to chase up. The surgery never conyacts you regarding a blood test result when there is a concern. If you do not chase them up, they will never chase you. The reception staff are often rude.

title: Good Practice
body:
GP was very helpful and professional during the appointment. 
Although getting an appointment is very difficult especially when at school/work and not able to stay waiting on the phone for a long time. The receptionists can also be quite rude over the phone.

title: Terrible
body: My grand daughter who is 2 developed an all over rash we were told there were no appointments left for the day but the duty doctor will call but don't know when! I went to the surgery to find an empty waiting room, I was told no appointments. I called Peartree to speak to the practice manager to be told she wasn't there and I must appreciate they are at their fill capacity but I didn't appreciate that when I had seen an empty waiting room. I explained I have a 2yr old with a rash all over her and got told it doesn't matter about age and there's no appointment but to me a baby with an all over rash is a priority in my book. In the end they put the phone down on my which added to my frustration, how is that helping a baby! I called West Horndon back more or less begging for 5minutes but the doctor had left.

title: Good experience
body: Originaly this was supposed to be a face to face appointment on 5th June but I was contacted with the option of having a telephone appointment to discuss my blood test results.  This I agreed to and was told it would be an am call. Very happy I wasn't kept waiting too long and got results explained. Overall a good experience.

title: Great Srrvice
body: I went for a blood test last week and received really excellent service. Staff were polite and reassuring. The Grange has improved 100% over the past twelve months really well done

author: severitywr98
title: Wonderful nurse
body: I attended the Minor injury department with an arm injury and was seen by Lorna, one of the nicest people I have come across. Nothing was a bother and she ensured I was seen to and given the best treatment. If every nurse was like her no one would want to leave the hospital, I hope this message gets back to her and hope she knows how wonderful a nurse she really is.

author: Andru19
title: My partner was treated poorly due to being mask-exempt
body:
I feel that the treatment towards my partner from the health service has been nothing less than shocking.  
My partner was mask-exempt during the covid pandemic. The midwives and admin staff, not happy with her being mask-exempt, treated her as if she had covid or the plague, very rude toward her also. The staff on the day of the c-section and the antenatal ward were not happy being near her due to not wearing mask as she is exempt.  
She then reached out to the mental health midwife during the pregnancy but was offered no help. She was late in receiving antibiotics for an infection in her c-section wound.  
Refused entry into the GP practice for a check up with our son. Then she moved practice, to still be not allowed entry due to not wearing a mask, even though being mask-exempt, and also told by receptionist that they refused to speak to her because her surname was different to our son's.  
So she removed herself from the GP practice altogether. The GP didn't try to stop this even though she was on the waiting list for the mental health team, which is a complete failure in the duty of care, in my eyes.  
A new health visitor was sent out to the house again due to my partner being mask-exempt. The health visitor told her to stay back from them, even though there was a good bit between them and they were at the front door - the health visitor had no mask on by the way. The health visitor was upset at the attitude (non-existing) shown by my partner, went and reported to the GP even though no longer a registered patient, social services were called for no reason at all.  
Had called the mental health team in the hospital due to feeling suicidal, was told by the nurse to ring lifeline instead.  
Not being able to attend appointments with either of our children, our daughter's speech and language appointments or vaccinations for either children, due to not being registered with a GP and being mask-exempt. GP also not willing to talk or discuss the children with partner due her not being registered with a GP practice.  
Told her problems will go away once registered again with a GP practice.  
Not one person she has spoke to within the health care system believed any of these experiences during COVID 19 were true. Made to feel it was all in her head.  
I really hope this is published as this site is for everyone to share their experiences whether good or bad. Reviews good or bad should be published.

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust
Royal College of Speech and Language Therapists (RCSLT)
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

title: appalling communication and lack of coordination.
body:
The surgery does not communicate with the hospital ,leaving the medical staff there clueless as to what the surgery are or aren't doing regarding my treatment. I had to resort to the frankly useless NHS app to show nurses at the hospital which tests the surgery had ordered, and what the results were. Prior to that, a consultant had to write to the surgery with some urgency, asking them to commence treatment for one condition, in order that I could be treated by the hospital for another.
One thing I am certain of, no-one at the surgery would want their health issues dealt with in such a haphazard fashion. How difficult can it be to phone or email a hospital department and coordinate treatment? Why do they rely on something as fallible as a patient, who is not a medical professional, to do it for them? Something as simple as a repeat prescription takes days to process. How can that be called effective or efficient, or even an improvement on what went before? The information screens in the waiting room fall well short of what they ought to. The receptionists try their best, but the layout of the room does not help them. Neither does it assist the medicos to have to come to reception and call the patients' names. Not at all 21st century, is it?
I could go on at even greater length, but why should I? The issues are clear to anyone with a critical eye who has been treated there. Much improvement is needed, and promptly. If this were a garage, I'd take my car somewhere else. Unfortunately, I'm not a car, so I'm stuck with it.

author: cafekm49
title: Dismissed and ignored
body:
My daughter has been struggling immensely with anxiety and depression over the past 2 years. It has become so bad, we actually ended up in A&E due to the physical symptoms she has been experiencing. Even her consultant who sees her for coeliac disease got involved and referred her to CAHMS with a view to being prescribed medication to help her to cope. CAHMS themselves say they strongly suspect she suffers from Autism. Yet she has a 2 year wait to be assessed for this. Despite all this, and the fact that her nervousness and anxiety is now affecting her college application, we have had a letter this week telling us CAHMS is not accepting the referral! They say she’s on a waiting list for Base51 counselling and that should be enough. The truth is we’ve had our initial assessment this month, and they’ve said it will be several months before we hear from them again! This is not helping at all!  
This is getting to the point now where I’m considering getting a solicitor involved and taking legal action, as this is seriously affecting her career prospects, not to mention the fact she is suffering so much. She can’t even bring herself to apply for a Saturday job due to her struggles, and we have found CAHMS absolutely awful in their support towards her. At the one meeting she had, she came away very upset as she felt ‘blamed’ for not doing the CBT she was given months before. But in actual fact, when her motivation is zero due to depression, this stops this from happening. Feeling blamed has completely turned her against the CBT.  
To now be refused any further help or medication is insulting. It’s as though no one believes her when she says she feels the way she does. CAHMS seem to be neglecting her needs and dismissing my concerns about her mental health. It should not be this hard to get support! You’re told to not be scared to ask for it, but when you do, you get dismissed!

title: Continuing Excellent Practice
body: As always at Werrington and at Peterborough a prompt, efficient, thorough and confidence boosting service always restores faith in the NHS . When I moved from the area I stayed registered with them to access hard working staff , caring and thorough doctors and a pro-active approach to health care . I couldn’t ask for more really. Thoroughly recommend.

title: Okay but needs big improvement
body: For the most part, the surgery is helpful and the staff seem to care about your issues. In my experience, getting an appointment booked and a follow-up test booked was simple on the whole. However, the hold time when calling up is far too long. Also, how many weeks/months go by before being provided with results from tests needs to be shortened.

title: New takeover is terrible
body: Cannot get through to speak to anyone. They have removed the queue wait number, now waiting over an hour on the phone. Never followed up with results of tests, had to go in to speak to someone. Reception said they now have over 20,000 patients across 4 practices - why on earth take on more patients and practices if you can’t even get one working properly. Moving doctors as this can’t go on.

title: Waiting for 3 weeks to register as pregnant
body:
Have tried:
Via email, phone call and their patches website that doesn't work. To register as a high-risk pregnancy.

Zero response.

Abysmal!

title: Dismissive Doctor
body: My experience with a Doctor was apalling. The doctor was not interested in explaining the procedure and involving the patient on what she wanted to do. For a sensitive department and role, compassion and patience is required in your daily iob

title: Thank you
body: I am fully aware of the fact, that the NHS is in trouble. However, from my own experience, the surgery and the hospital treated me extremely well. Thank you to all of you. Ingrid

title: Useless
body:
I have to give my pharmacy 7 days to get my prescription on time.
But the surgery won't approve it until the day it's due ? Some of the staff are rude cold .I've been accused of shouting by one of the staff .
You will be sorry if you choose this poor practice

title: Excellent Practice
body: Professional, efficient and friendly service by both the Doctor and Receptionist on this visit and past visits. The Doctor explained my blood test results and gave advice on other long term medical issues including the options and positive way forward to manage them. This visit was, as usual, carried out in a professional, respectful, supportive, and friendly manner.

title: Excellent service
body: From arriving for a 9.30 appointment and booking in the journey through the system was simple and easy. Everything was explained in plain english as I passed through the different stages right up till everything was completed and was able to go home. Thankyou SpaMedica.

title: Appointment
body: I've been living in Chorlton for two years and I tried to do an appointment  with the doctor and I can't because I'm inactive!! Today I filled out the form for the third time!! now I have to wait a month to see if I can make the appointment or I'll have to fill out the form again!! Please, I need to see the doctor, I have a great pain in my knees

author: Robert 72
title: Very impressed with the quality of care
body:
Admitted to Ward 52 in the Victoria Hospital in Kirkcaldy. Everyone from the Consultant/doctors (Mr Koffeman, Danielle & Liam), nursing staff (especially Nicola and Laura) and all of the support staff were excellent. Every step of the process was explained in clear easy to understand language and everyone made me feel relaxed and at ease with the whole process. Nothing was a problem with any request although the ward was very busy throughout my stay. Both of my daughters who work in the NHS though in a different health board, were also very impressed with the quality of care I received.  
Food was also very good with reasonable portions. The same was true for the staff in the Assessment Unit 2.

title: Continuing Excellence
body: Nothing but praise for this surgery after 13 years registered. Pro-active in health care and good service when you need them . 5 star rating in my book.

title: Disgraceful
body: on many occasions this practice messed up my prescription, one time the receptionist said my prescription had been thrown in the bin. When i complained I was told in no uncertain terms "if I don`t like it here then to find a another surgery", So thats exactly what I did.

title: The kindest and most professional practice
body: I had a biopsy at my womb and the whole team was absolutely amazing, they work as  a fantastic team together. The doctors explained me and answered my questions professional and patiently. During the process, they were kind, checked on me all the time and explained what was happening. The nurses of the team were extremely kind, they held my hand, looked after me and supported me the best way I could wish. I am so grateful and really appreciate their work and treatment.

readBy.name: Salford Royal NHS Foundation Trust (Renal AQuA)

title: I am grateful that this practice is on the…
body: The Number of people in the locality is ever-rising, especially with the new property in the villages.  In my recent (June 2023) experience, this practice, and all those that are employed there, work brilliantly considering the never-ending pressure being placed on them and the NHS.  Having read some reviews of others, I did wonder if we had actually been to the same place.  Thank you Ninfield Surgery.

title: Great practice
body: Every dealing with every member of staff since registering my elderly mother at the end of April has been excellent. Courteous, helpful, very efficient staff help to turn situations of concern into positive ones.

title: Shambles
body:
Impossible to break through the wall of receptionists. You have to join the queue on the phone at 8.00. Then, if you're lucky enough to get through in the first batch of callers you can book a telephone appointment with the doctor. Not a real appt. Just a phone call. You can easily spend upwards of an hour in the queue, only to end up getting through and told you're too late and you have to go through the same thing tomorrow. If you work, how on earth are you supposed to sit for ages on your phone just in the hope of possibly getting a call from the doctor later on? And if you don't, you have to hope your employer doesn't mind you spending ages on the phone the next day.
Even if you don't need an appointment, and you just need to quickly check something with the Dr, you still have to go through the same nonsense.

title: Bad service
body: After waiting over and hour to make an appointment for an unwell 3 year old I was told to call back the next day. After waiting in a queue at 08:00 am I was then told emergency appointments don’t exist now and a form needs completing. This is the third or fourth time I have called and received unhelpful, rude and unprofessional attitude from the receptionist. As I can see from reviews I am definitely not the only one to receive this service from the receptionist. This needs addressing before they lose another family from the practice as my family and I will certainly be leaving.

author: correspondencegz48
title: I am so grateful
body:
I have nothing but praise for the care I have had since I left that awful care home.  
My physio carers have been wonderful and have helped me a lot. I am so grateful to them for what they did.

readBy.name: Perth and Kinross Health & Social Care Partnership

title: Failure at point of entry
body: I rarely trouble my local GP. I am one of those men who only goes to the doctor when something is very wrong. I rang today to get an urgent appointment because I have a lump near my thyroid which has persisted for the last 2-3 months. I have difficulty swallowing and no infection. The receptionist was dismissive and offered an appointment in a months time. At a time when so many people are being diagnosed with cancer too late, it is shocking that one of the significant reasons for late diagnosis is likely to be receptionists who are simply not qualified to be in the critical diagnosis pathway.

title: What a doctors should be
body: Finally a doctors surgery that is how they should be kind, caring, helpful friendly and actually want you to feel better both admin and doctors 10/10 well done.

title: Not good enough.
body:
For 4 months i have been trying to get an appointment about my knee. I had a acl, mcl and meniscus surgery 12 years ago and suffer on a dailiy basis. I have spoken to other medical people and they have said it needs looking at but this can not be done as you cannot get an appointment. 
I fully understand that alot are of people like my self who do not get seen 9r even get to talk to a doctor. 
I also suffer from really bad indigestion that makes me violently sick. To the point that i get blood spots on my face. 
I have been fobbed off so many times, told to do an econstult and that says you need to talk to a doctor . 

The excuse of not enough doctors is a joke. My girlfriend gets appointments all the time in Middlesbrough.

Something seriously needs to be done to make sure patients are seen as there are alot of people who's medical needs are not being met.

title: Disgusting service
body:
Where to begin! No replies to the online forms, over a week for a change of sick note and extend, literally a 2 minute job if that! Making the reason for been off worse when getting ignored! When you do try to call only open from 11-3 what the hell is that about! 

If this was any other job youd get the sack for treating people how you do! 

No wonder the NHS is going down the pan!

title: appointments
body: i rang at 0800 this morning to be told to press option 1 if you required a call back this did not happen this is not the first time this has happened then to be told you get a call back from a doctor between the time you called to 12md  this is terrible the last time i called the surgery there was so much laughing  i had to ask the receptionist to speak up because i could not here them  its no wonder you cannot get thought

title: Good/ Practice Move
body: Generally, we are fortunate to have experienced doctors and staff who try hard to meet demands whilst having increasing workloads and expectations. The move to better premises (along with the Fountain practice) can only be beneficial to all. My one suggestion is that this is an opportunity to update and change the telephone recorded message system. The electronic 'voices' need to be listened to in order to know why this would be a good thing to change. Best wishes

title: appointments
body: i rang the surgery today to be told if i required a call back to press option 1 again i did not get the call back i had to ring again to be told that if i wanted to speak to a doctor it would be between the time i rang to 12 midday. this terrible the last time a few months back there was so much laughing i could not even hear the receptionist  i had tgo keep asking him to repeat what he was saying tghis terrible

author: CourtneyJs24
title: Signet baby massage group
body:
Having my baby join the signets baby massage and incredible babies is one of the best things I have done for me and my son.  
I love going every week, seeing the other mummies, watching our babies grow and interact and learning as well how to look after and have more information on the care we give.  
Jayne, Zoe and Angela are absolutely fabulous and very supportive, their outlook and perspective on things is very helpful be you a first time parent or not.  
Signets is a group I look forward to attending every week and I know my son loves it too, I would love for more mummies to enjoy and join in on this group just as much as we do!  
As daunting as being a new parent can be this is a group that can help get rid of that feeling.  
And It breaks my heart that soon enough the group will finish.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Absolutely Terrible
body: This practice used to be good but the last few years it has gone so downhill it’s unreal. Recently had surgery and was told I need my dressing changed by a medical professional (doctor/nurse) at least every other day as I’m vulnerable and high risk. After being on hold for 45 mins, a receptionist with an unbothered tone tells me they can see me in 6 days as they are too busy. so I have to attempt to do it myself even though it’s in a position I can’t reach or see and don’t know if I’m doing it right

title: Great people, great practice
body: Did a smear test, the nurse was so kind, compassionate and understanding, she make the whole procedure easy and comfortable for me. We'll done

author: Abisz74
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Good and Helpful
body: The nurses were good and helpful

readBy.name: Southern Health Mid & North Hampshire Division

title: Exemplary service
body: Very prompt and friendly service, nothing to much trouble. Makes you feel at ease about phoning with any problems.

title: Efficient and effective
body:
Neede full hip replacement.  Always received great service & staff were excellent. 
Stay at Thornbury was great.
Aftercare has been attentive & relevant

author: gruswm54
title: Lovely experience of CBT
body:
I had a lovely experience of CBT . Quite happy.  
[Very happy with 'Staff attitude']  
  
[Very happy with 'Being listened to']  
  
[Very happy with 'Being given time']  
[Very happy with 'Appointments']

author: Abisz74
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Above and Beyond
body:
Been a really good service. Lovely to see a member of the team each day.  
Going above and beyond.  
Thanks all that have visited from UCR

readBy.name: Southern Health Mid & North Hampshire Division

author: Disney Mummy
title: Our son's recent visit to the hospital
body:
Our son is autistic, non-verbal with sensory processing and learning difficulties, and needed dental work done. There is no other way for this to happen except under general anaesthetic.  
The care and support we received on the day was amazing but even more exceptional was the work done in the background on the lead up to the day which meant it was the best experience for our son as it possibly could be. Ensuring he was first into the ward, had his own room, everything was kept calm, and the staff went with whatever worked for him. They were prepared to give him an alternative pre-med having read his notes and seen one he had previously hadn't worked. He was also first on the list so we didn't need to wait any longer than was necessary for him to be taken to theatre.  
All through the day the staff were all brilliant, taking our lead, keeping the environment as calm and settled for our son as possible. We don't know all the names of the staff who support our son, the dentist was Jill and the procedure took place at the at the start of May 2023. We would love it if those who supported our son were recognised for the wonderful work they do and that they know how much we, as a family, appreciated them.  
In addition, when we first knew our son would need to go into hospital and be under general anaesthetic his own dentist, Gillian, who is based at the Royal Alexandra Hospital dental department, asked us if there was anything else we would want done. We asked about a hair cut and later about the possibility of giving him a vaccine he hadn't had. These might seem straightforward things but to a child like our son, who is now a teenager, big and strong it is impossible to get anywhere near him to do things he doesn't want to. We hadn't been able to cut his hair for 3 years and he hadn't had any vaccinations since he was 5yrs old.  
We don't know who, but somebody in the NHS arranged for a professional hairdresser to be in theatre with our son that day, the anaesthetist give him the HPV vaccine he hadn't been able to have and the dentist even cut his finger and toe nails. We would love if someone could find out who the wonderful person was who arranged for the hairdresser, and say a massive thank you from us. The hairdresser, herself did an amazing job, our boy looked so handsome when we got him back from theatre and for all the staff in theatre who we didn't meet on the day for working round all of this going on, just to make our son's and our lives just a little bit better, we truly can't thank them all enough.

author: chamaeleonfx34
title: It felt like VIP treatment!
body:
I had an operation on my lower eyelid, at the Mater hospital in Belfast today. It was a day procedure, from the ophthalmology service, this morning.  
I arrived early this morning and got the VIP treatment all the way. Nurse Ruth took all my details such as my medications etc. and was very nice and caring, she brought me to another department where I waited for ten mins, then the surgeon came and interviewed me, he told me what he was going to do, and again it felt like VIP treatment.  
On the recovery ward, I had toast and milk which as very very welcome and I waited on my lift coming and they had to come 40 miles so I had to wait a while. Mary was the charge nurse and looked after me very well, and someone escorted me out to the car, and I couldn’t be more grateful for the service I received today. I couldn’t add anything that would have made it better, it was just perfect.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: Liz283
title: Staff were very reassuring
body: My mother had cataract surgery. The procedure was very straightforward. Staff were very reassuring and my mum is already delighted with the results. The nurse explaining everything at her discharge was so good. She spoke slowly, clearly and ensuring mum understood everything. The post operation paperwork was first class. Here’s hoping the procedure is just as good when she gets the second eye done

author: susqm36
title: Treated with dignity, care and respect
body:
I would like to share the excellent care my Uncle received in ward A6 following his stroke and subsequent death.  
At all times my family and my uncle were at the center of all the decision making. When difficult decisions needed to be made in terms of Do not resuscitate order and withdrawal of treatment they were made with care compassion and support of the lovely Doctor Hannah and the nursing team.  
He was cared for with dignity, care and respect and his last days were spent with family around in the lovely single room .

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences
